coffeePots.name: Expresso Machine
coffeePots.description: An espresso machine is a specialized coffee brewing device designed to create espresso, a concentrated form of coffee made by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee under high pressure.

coffeePots.name: Drip Coffee Maker
coffeePots.description: A drip coffee maker is a type of coffee machine that brews coffee by dripping hot water over ground coffee beans contained in a filter. The water slowly percolates through the coffee grounds, extracting their flavors, and then drips into a carafe or pot below. This method produces a smooth and consistent cup of coffee, making it a popular choice for home and office use.

coffeePots.name: French Press
coffeePots.description: The French Press, also known as a press pot or plunger pot, extracts coffee using the immersion method. In this method, coarsely ground coffee is steeped in hot water for an extended period, usually around 4 to 5 minutes. This allows for a full extraction of the coffee's flavors and oils, resulting in a rich and full-bodied cup of coffee.

coffeePots.name: Moka
coffeePots.description: The Moka pot is a stovetop coffee maker that brews coffee by passing hot water, driven by steam pressure, through ground coffee. It consists of three main parts: a bottom chamber for water, a middle funnel-shaped filter for ground coffee, and a top chamber where the brewed coffee collects.

coffeePots.name: Pour-Over Coffee Maker
coffeePots.description: A Pour-Over Coffee Maker is a manual coffee brewing method that involves pouring hot water over coffee grounds in a filter. The water flows through the coffee, extracting flavors and aromas, and then drips into a carafe or mug below. This method allows for precise control over the brewing process, including water temperature, pour rate, and brew time, resulting in a clean, flavorful cup of coffee.

coffeePots.name: Cold Brew Coffee Maker
coffeePots.description: Cold brew coffee is made by steeping coarsely ground coffee beans in cold water for an extended period, typically between 12 to 24 hours. This method results in a smooth, less acidic coffee concentrate that can be diluted with water or milk before serving. Cold brew is often enjoyed over ice and can be stored in the refrigerator for several days.

coffeePots.name: AeropressEDIT
coffeePots.description: The AeroPress is a popular manual coffee maker known for its versatility and ability to produce a rich, smooth coffee. It uses a combination of immersion and pressure to brew coffee, where ground coffee is steeped in hot water and then forced through a filter by pressing down a plunger.

coffeePots.name: Percolator
coffeePots.description: A percolator is a type of coffee maker that brews coffee by cycling boiling water through coffee grounds using gravity. The percolator has a pot, a tube, and a perforated basket that holds the coffee grounds. As the water heats, it is pushed up through the central tube and then flows over the coffee grounds, extracting the flavors and aromas before dripping back down into the main chamber. This cycle repeats until the desired strength of coffee is reached.

coffeePots.name: Single-Serve Pod Coffee Maker
coffeePots.description: A single-serve coffee maker, also known as a single-serve pot coffee maker, is designed to brew a single cup of coffee at a time. These machines are popular for their convenience, speed, and ability to brew coffee with minimal cleanup. They typically use pre-packaged coffee pods or capsules, although some models also offer the option to use ground coffee.

coffees.name: Nicaragua - Matagalpa
cata_notes: Notes of nuts
hazelnuts and apple
Velvety body, medium-subtle sweetness and malic acidity.
coffees.description: Las Blanquitas¨ communities are behind this coffee grown in the Peñas Blancas Massif located in the department of Matagalpa, Nicaragua.These communities are made up of descendants of several indigenous tribes such as the Mismitos and Mayagnas who live in the Peñas Blancas Massif and who, like their ancestors, take advantage of the fertility of the area's soils and the abundance of water to grow coffee in the traditional way.This coffee comes from a natural park where entire families work together using manual techniques that respect the biodiversity of the area for coffee cultivation.

coffees.name: Colombia - Quindío
cata_notes: Sweet caramel flavor
ripe fruits and subtle chocolate notes
Delicate and citric acidity, silky medium body, clean and lasting dark caramel residual.
coffees.description: Don Julián continues the family tradition of growing coffee in the highlands of Quindío, Colombia.Don Julián's main objective is to promote high quality coffee, as well as transmit the love and passion for the coffee culture that is passed from generation to generation and innovating in the art of growing, drying and roasting specialty coffees.Thanks to people so dedicated and careful in their techniques, we can deliver to your home a coffee of certified origin and natural production that has been collected manually to give you the best of Colombia.

coffees.name: Etiopía - Sidama
cata_notes: Clean fruity cup in which the flavor of yellow fruits (peach and apricot) stands out; with floral notes of jasmine
Dark chocolate and vanilla
Medium-high malic acidity and medium buttery body
coffees.description: The coffee plant, the coffee plant, is native to Ethiopia, whose ancestors discovered and recognized the energizing effects of coffee.In this area, coffee matures slowly at cool temperatures, due to the height of the forests in which it grows wild, resulting in a very diverse, high-quality coffee with complex flavors. It is later collected by coffee growers in a traditional manual way.There is such a tradition in this country that drinking coffee becomes a forty-five minute ritual. Since the beans are roasted at the moment over the ember, ground in a mortar and served in small cups without handles.We invite you to reproduce the ritual in your home.

coffees.name: Honduras - Santa Bárbara
cata_notes: Fruity fragrance, intense fruit aromas
lively orange acidity, velvety flavor
balanced body, medium sweetness and a smooth finish.
coffees.description: Ivo Enamorado is the farmer behind the pampered ¨Las Cúspides¨ farm, located in Santa Bárbara, a Honduran region bordering Guatemala that carefully produces the best coffees in Honduras.This farmer, and his good practices, have led his farm to a form of cultivation compatible with respect for the environment and native species.Ivo has made a great effort to produce his coffee responsibly, his good practices begin with the full transformation of people, since it is with them that the change begins. Their commitment has always been and will be to contribute to the improvement of the values ​​of the community.Their work is on the earth and this coffee is its fruit.

coffees.name: Costa Rica - Tarrazú
cata_notes: Bright acidity with a clean, balanced body
Notes of citrus and honey
Smooth finish with a subtle sweetness
coffees.description: Tarrazú coffee from Costa Rica is famous for its bright acidity and clean, balanced body. Grown in the high altitudes of Tarrazú, the coffee has a smooth finish with subtle sweetness, making it a favorite among coffee connoisseurs.

coffees.name: Guatemala - Antigua
cata_notes: Complex flavors with notes of cocoa and spice
Bright acidity and a full body
Smooth, lingering finish
coffees.description: Antigua, Guatemala, is known for its complex flavors and full body, often with notes of cocoa and spice. This coffee is carefully processed to maintain its bright acidity and smooth, lingering finish.

coffees.name: Ethiopia - Yirgacheffe
cata_notes: Floral and fruity notes with a hint of jasmine
Bright acidity and medium body
Clean finish with a slight sweetness
coffees.description: Yirgacheffe coffee is renowned for its floral and fruity notes, with a hint of jasmine. This Ethiopian coffee is grown at high altitudes, giving it a bright acidity and clean, slightly sweet finish.

Smooth and balanced with a rich texture
coffees.description: Brazilian Cerrado coffee is famous for its nutty flavors and smooth, balanced texture. This coffee has a chocolatey finish, making it a favorite for those who enjoy a rich, yet smooth cup.

coffees.description: Huila, Colombia, is renowned for producing high-quality coffee with sweet notes of caramel and honey. The beans are grown at high altitudes and processed with care to ensure a smooth and balanced cup.

coffees.description: Panama's Volcán region is famous for producing some of the best Geisha coffee in the world. Known for its complex floral notes and high acidity, this coffee is a true delicacy for coffee enthusiasts.
